description: From Middle French urbain (“urban, belonging to a city; also: polite, courteous, elegant, urbane”), from Latin urbānus (“belonging to a city”), with a sense of “having the manners of townspeople” in Classical Latin, from urbs (“city”).

adjectives.description: urbane (comparative urbaner or more urbane, superlative urbanest or most urbane)

entries.meaning: (of a person, usually a man) Courteous, polite, refined, and suave.
